PATIENT_ID: TEST_RIB_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-21 08:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-21 08:15:00
Category II trauma activation for 55-year-old male after fall from ladder.
BP 130/80, HR 88, RR 20, GCS 15. Alert and oriented.
Chest wall tenderness on palpation of left lateral ribs.
Pain assessment: NRS 7/10 at rest, 9/10 with deep inspiration.
Rib fracture management protocol to be initiated pending imaging.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-21 08:45:00
CT Chest with 3D reconstruction:
Fractures of left ribs 5, 6, 7 and 8 identified.
No pneumothorax. Small left pleural effusion.
Rib fracture locations confirmed on imaging.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-21 10:00:00
Patient assessed. Respiratory rate 18 breaths per minute.
Incentive spirometry measurement: 1250 mL (goal 1500 mL).
Cough effort: moderate, able to clear secretions with splinting.
Pain score reassessed: NRS 5/10 after multimodal analgesia.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-21 10:30:00
Rib fracture management protocol initiated.
Pain management plan: scheduled acetaminophen, PRN oxycodone, rib block considered.
Pulmonary toilet regimen ordered. Continue incentive spirometry q1h while awake.
